intro: Orobus sparsiflorus, commonly known as the sparseflower orobus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, commonly known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its small, upright growth habit and clusters of pea-like flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Orobus sparsiflorus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
